revised_title: Characterization of Tetrodotoxin-Sensitive Sodium Currents in Native Xenopus Oocytes
tldr: The authors discovered that some native Xenopus oocytes exhibit a transient inward sodium current that is blocked by tetrodotoxin and prolonged by veratrine. The sodium currents in oocytes from different donors showed varying kinetics, suggesting the expression of different sodium channels. These findings may complicate experiments studying the expression of foreign sodium channels in oocytes.
